column1: Provide a listing of groups serving immigrants needs for food and rent assistance in the minneapolis-St. Paul metro area with focus on these counties: Ramsey, Hennepin, Dakota, Washington and Scott.

Provide these columns: organization name, website, phone #, address, populations served and services offered, county name, # of employees, year founded, whether volunteers are needed, any current focus on ICE resistance.

Below is a starter directory of Minneapolis–St. Paul metro organizations that commonly serve immigrants/refugees (or explicitly include them) with food and/or rent/housing stability help, organized to emphasize Ramsey, Hennepin, Dakota, Washington, and Scott Counties.  For “# employees,” I used publicly listed figures (often from IRS/990 aggregators or org profiles), so treat as approximate.
What I mean by “ICE resistance” here: public-facing Know-Your-Rights education, legal defense/representation, accompaniment/rapid-response organizing, or policy/advocacy—not anything about evasion.

column5: populations served and services offered
column10: any current focus on ICE resistance

column1: 360 Communities – Burnsville Resource Center & Food Shelf
column5: South metro residents; food shelf and stability services; programs adjusted over time (see site for current financial assistance availability).

column4: Messiah Lutheran Church, 16725 Highview Ave, Lakeville, MN 55044
column5: Food shelf serving Lakeville/south metro; appointments and emergency food options (see site for details).
Dakota County residents; emergency services and housing supports, including eviction prevention/resources (availability can vary).

column4: Northern Service Center: 1 Mendota Rd W, Suite 100, West St. Paul, MN 55118 (plus other locations)
column5: Dakota County residents; emergency assistance for housing/utility crises and related public benefits support.
Hastings area; Market food shelf and community resource assistance (including rent assistance for eligible households).
Somali and East African community members; halal food shelf and culturally specific food assistance; volunteer opportunities available.
column10: No explicit; immigrant-serving org that may refer to legal resources.

column4: 222 Grand Ave W, South St. Paul, MN 55075
column5: Northern Dakota County residents; emergency assistance (incl. housing-related) and food shelf support.

column4: 3000 Ames Crossing Rd, Suite 100, Eagan, MN 55121
column5: Dakota County residents needing food; pantry plus mobile sites; multilingual access varies by site.

column1: CAPI USA (Communities Advancing Prosperity for Immigrants)
column5: Immigrants, refugees, and communities of color; services include food shelf access plus economic/human services supports; multilingual assistance.
column10: Indirect (immigrant support; not explicitly ICE-focused on contact page).

column5: Latino/a and other immigrant communities; culturally responsive services and referrals; employment supports and connections to basic needs resources.
column10: Indirect (not explicitly ICE-focused on locations page).

column5: Wide range of housing and basic needs services (shelter, housing support, referrals).

column1: Community Action Partnership of Hennepin County (CAP-HC)
column4: 8800 Hwy 7, Ste 401 (or #403), St. Louis Park, MN 55426
column5: Low-income Hennepin County residents; programs include rental assistance, energy/water assistance and other supports.
Residents in need (northwest metro); food shelf and housing navigation, benefits help, and connections to rent/utility resources.
Minnesota renters; free legal advice to prevent eviction/resolve housing problems; language lines available (e.g., Spanish, Somali, Hmong).
Community members needing food; food shelf appointments and connections to services; volunteer opportunities.

column1: Jewish Family and Children’s Service of Minnesota (JFCS)
column4: 5905 Golden Valley Rd, Golden Valley, MN 55422
column5: All faiths/backgrounds; emergency financial assistance grants/loans (when available) to help with basic needs and stability.

column4: 1220 Zane Ave N, Golden Valley, MN 55422
column5: Northwest metro residents; food assistance and housing assistance (eviction prevention/resources).

column1: PROP (People Reaching Out to People) – Eden Prairie
column5: Community members in crisis; food shelf plus short-term emergency financial assistance (incl. housing-related).
Families experiencing homelessness (many immigrant families served); shelter, meals and supportive services; volunteer opportunities.

column1: Pillsbury United Communities – Brian Coyle Center (Food Shelf)
column5: Residents needing food support; food shelf/food distribution at multiple sites; referrals to housing and other supports.

column4: St. Louis Park, MN (serves St. Louis Park residents)
column5: St. Louis Park residents; food assistance and crisis rent assistance (case-by-case) plus advocacy/referrals.
Hennepin County residents facing food/housing instability; food distribution and housing services (rent/mortgage/utility help and resources).
People experiencing homelessness; housing support and services; referrals and coordinated entry information.

column1: The Advocates for Human Rights (Immigrant Client Line)
column5: Immigrants in Upper Midwest; immigration legal services, including people detained by immigration, asylum seekers, trafficking victims; Know Your Rights resources.

column1: The Food Group (Food HelpLine / Fare For All / food bank)
column5: Regional food support; runs/partners on food access programs and referral HelpLine; supports food shelves across the metro.

column1: The Salvation Army – North Minneapolis (Parkview Worship & Service Center)
column5: North Minneapolis residents; client-choice food shelf and emergency financial assistance including rental and utility assistance.
Residents needing food and financial help (Bloomington/Richfield/Edina/South Mpls areas); food pantry and assistance/referrals, including housing-related crises.

column1: CLUES (Comunidades Latinas Unidas En Servicio) – St. Paul
column5: Latino/a and other immigrant communities; culturally responsive services and referrals. Basic needs navigation, health & wellness, employment support; can help connect to food/housing resources.
column10: Indirect (community support; not explicitly ICE-focused on contact page)

column5: Low-income residents of Ramsey & Washington counties; community action programs (e.g., housing stability/energy & other supports; referrals for emergency needs).

column4: 394 University Ave W, 2nd Fl, Saint Paul, MN 55103

column4: 450 N Syndicate St, Suite 200, St. Paul, MN 55104
column5: Immigrants statewide; immigration legal services, resources, and referrals.

column5: Karen refugees and other immigrants/refugees; social services, employment and community supports; can help connect families to basic needs resources.
column10: No explicit; may refer to immigration legal resources.

column4: 1800 University Ave W, Saint Paul, MN 55104
column5: Residents needing basic needs support; food shelf/food distribution and supportive services; crisis support and referrals.
column10: No explicit; provides basic needs assistance.

column4: 277 University Ave W, Saint Paul, MN 55103

column4: 128 N Meridian St, Belle Plaine, MN 56011

column5: Scott County residents; crisis funds/emergency general assistance and other public benefits.
